Reviews.Title: “Super stay.”
Reviews.Author: Ross S
Reviews.Content: This the second time we have stayed and this time my son and his family joined us in Singapore. From the time we checked in our stay was the "total hotel experience". There was a mistake with the booking with my son's suite and after a bit of sorting around they bwere upgraded to the pethouse suite, I would like to thank Siti at the desk for doing this for us as it made our stay such a special one. William, in the Pacific Lounge also took great care of us during the cocktail evenings and the staff in the breakfast restaurant were awesome. The Pan Pacific Hotel is well worth a visit and you should stay in one of the Pacific Suites as they are very comfortable and well presented. My 2 year old grand daughter was totally impressed with the large fish tank in th foyer. Wonderful hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karl W
Reviews.Content: The employees were very helpful. The suite was very well and tasteful design. Housekeeping did an outstanding job. The room was clean. Great bathroom amenities. Breakfast at the Pacific Club Lounge was outstanding. I needed breakfast at 5:30 and the staff at the coffee shop were very helpful evenso they were busy setting up an impressive breakfast buffet. Doorman and bell staff are very friendly and helpful. In short it's a hotel I love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Permanent improvements in various aereas to be highlighted!”
Reviews.Author: Reinhard C
Reviews.Content: My experience as a rare but regular guest with this hotel changed over the years according to neccessary improvements already implemented., for example a lounge. As I was informed further upgradings will take place still this year floor-by-floor. The management will certainly also address a highlight of the hotel: the large swimming pool aera. One issue had never changed: the : the reception at the lobby and by the reception had been- in most of the cases- overwhelming , a reason to remain a loyal guest and recommend this place to friends of mine--last but not least for the ideal location very close to Orchard Rd.

Reviews.Title: “span pacific orchard”
Reviews.Author: stevekDubai
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in good location for night life & shopping Clean rooms , with great showers , wi fi and attentive staff Excellent front staff and lobby area , fun and good at thier jobs Good food and worth trying Good value for money & ok both for business & family

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in heart of the shopping district”
Reviews.Author: Angela J
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pac Orchard is in a great location right on Orchard Road close to the MRT, it was competatively priced and the service was great. The room's had everything in them you could need and the staff were always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific Orchard”
Reviews.Author: Sr887
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Hotel is clean, tasty food, good service. Wi-fi was available in the room. Privilege status makes your staying more comfortable. Fitness room gear is very good. Swimming pool is clean; about 20 m long and 1.4 m depth. Water without chlorine taste gives a great sensation There is very comfortable dressing room with shower. Steam sauna just great; dry sauna has about 82 C - was weak for me, benches needs some cleaning. I prefer dry sauna above 100C. Hotel is well situated.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore. Much more than the stopover point people think it is!”
Reviews.Author: koscar2000
Reviews.Content: This is a well priced hotel in a good location just off Orchard Rd. the room was very spacious with a lovely bathroom and the friendliest and most helpful staff, nothing was too much trouble. Our first night we had a problem with our hot wet, which was promptly fixed and the next day when we returned the management had put a delicious dessert tray in our room with an apology letter. The restaurant was fabulous with the best value for money Buffet Dinner with the most stunningly presented food I have ever seen and the selection was incredible. The pool was lovely and refreshing to dive into after traipsing around in the humidity which is the only downside of Singapore. I am already keen to go back to this lovely hotel and city.

Reviews.Title: “awful experience at check in”
Reviews.Author: f m
Reviews.Content: they do not have a room till 3 to 4 hours after check in. This is between christmas and new year. we have come a few times. It is the same every time.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: jc w
Reviews.Content: As we arrived the troubles started At reception we where told that our room Preference was not available after talking for a while with front desk we where offered a smaller normal room and that we would have to wait until tomorrow for the room we desired, I started to get emotional (3 flights , 18 hours, I was tired). The Manager appeared and sorted it out knowing exactly who we where explaning that he had received an email prior explaining that it was our honeymoon and we just wanted a stress free stay . We waited having a small bit to eat and was given our room keys and told we would receive a phone call confirming the options we had booked including a turn down service .(never received the call as the phone had not been put back properly before we got to the room ,and only realized at 11 pm and had to go down to reception not greeted professionally and was told it was too late for evening option etc to come back in the morning,In my opinion they could have sent someone to the room.... The suite upgrade was gorgeous (minus the ash on the coffee table and bed side cabinet (not the end of the world) we received a complimentary bottle of champagne started to open the bottle when the lights and air con went out. second time down to reception , third time an electrician came to the room (by this time it was past 11 pm) had the door wide open for 20mins trying to fix the lights (kills a romantic honeymoon mood completely) he left us his key as with the fixing he did our keys no longer worked.(strangely no one informed the Manager of these problems) The next day we went to reception to book a theater show (new day let's try and start fresh) nope the reception lady was annoyed about booking a show for us (and this continued for the stay) I can understand one or two people having a bad day but not all of the front desk ! (singapore flyer tickets same problem etc ) as if we where imposing on them. The club lounge was nice but have to wait a long time to receive breakfast . All in all the location is great the pool is fantastic (except one woman that was smoking at the corner of the pool even being a smoker myself ,it's a no smoke zone and little children where in the pool). If the manager was not as helpful and genuinely concerned about our stay ,and the floor staff as smiley and nice It would have felt like a horrible time . They make up for the front desk . Not sure if I would stay here again , As still disappointed ,you only get one honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “May consider staying again”
Reviews.Author: equinoxism
Reviews.Content: Location - The location of the hotel is perfect. It's at Orchard yet the main lobby isn't facing the busy street - which makes it good as it's quiet. Room - Room is not as spacious as some hotels. Interestingly, there is no ledge to put the luggage as with most hotels. Had to squeeze the oversized luggage into the closet. Internet - No wireless internet which is a let down. TV - One of the tiniest TV I have ever seen for a hotel this quality. Food - Acceptable. Can be better though.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniant and a pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: travel_freak90
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and conveniant to the shops. Downside is the tv is pretty old and no wireless in the room. Very clean and service was great! Was told they'll be upgrading their facilities by aug 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Airshow”
Reviews.Author: Tony960
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific (Orchard) was clean, friendly and efficient. The Hotel was full but remained personal and friendly. Location is ideal for eating and shopping with easy access to the main shopping centers.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Mikey-st1
Reviews.Content: I love staying at the Pan Pacific Orchard Hotel. The location is perfect right near Orchard Road. The cuisine in the restaurant is fantastic, especially the breakfast. The pool was also excellent after a long day in the humidity!

Reviews.Title: “Little disapointed”
Reviews.Author: dyava
Reviews.Content: In January 2012 I spent two nights in the Pan Pacific Orchard hotel. Hm... really hard to describe my impressions. The property is just off the Orchard Road full of department stores and all the shops you can need, so the location is perfect. The hotel is quite old and definitely needs refurbishment or at least facelift. The rooms are spacious but old fashioned as well as the bathroom. The good thing is - my room was very clean! There is only LAN (cable) internet in the room. The hotel's breakfast are disastrous - comparing to other asian hotels. So, mixture of some good and bad things but absolutely not worth of the money I spent.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonyRobotham
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel twice, handy for Orchard road which is the main "drag" for the shopping area, choice of shops ranging from 7/11 shop to Channel and Rolex on the same street. Hotel was good quality and the room rates are decent for a central located hotel. Worth looking at the combination upgrade packages that include breakfast and internet so can actuually work out cheaper. Breakfast buffet was of good standard. Room views are limited as surrounded by other tower blocks, but this is the same for anywhere in Singapore. Decent swimming pool and hotel staff helpful. If arriving by car, hotel has own car park which is free to guests. Would stay again if visiting Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: SmartTraveller
Reviews.Content: If you want proximity to shopping/Orchard Road, this is a good pick as you can go out the back door of the hotel, through a small mall and you are on Orchard Road, not far from the intersection of Scotts Roads. However, that was the best thing about the hotel. Whilst it was ok, it was not a patch on it's sister hotel, the Pan Pacific Singapore which is where I normally stay. If the hotel was not in Singapore, you'd rate the service as being good. However it fell way below Singapore 4 & 5 star standards. I had a suite and whilst nicely furnished, it had seen much better days. It didnt even have a desk - I am a business traveller so this is important to me as I dont like working in the same room in which I sleep. The bed was rock, rock hard - my back ached for two days after leaving. Pillows were ok The Pacific lounge was nicely furnished/decorated. Canapes in the evening - well there were hardly any and what was there was very average so I didnt bother going the second night. Breakfast was quite nice although some of the staff left a bit to be desired. On my first morning (Saturday), a menu was shoved in my face and I was asked to make a selection while standing in the middle of the lounge, before I had even sat down!! He did the same to the guy who came in after me and he got really annoyed and barked at the server to let him sit down and consider it. Staff on the Sunday morning were excellent. Reception staff were efficient but pretty cold/unfriendly. The telephone service line took so long to be answered one night, I was just about to put the phone done in disgust when it was finally answered. The mineral pool was freezing - it was no wonder that no-one was out there - it was unuseable Whilst the weather was unusually cool for Singapore, the next hotel I stayed in, their pool was warm and useable so I suspect their filtration method makes the water cold. Would I come back - perhaps if I REALLY needed to be in this location again. I wouldnt bother with suite or Club room as it was a complete waste of money. From photos, the ordinary room has a desk and the Pacific Club is ordinary, It is reasonable value for money but dont expect a luxury hotel for your money.

Reviews.Title: “This is not the Pan Pacific that I thought it was....”
Reviews.Author: Shayne C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location , the rooms are clean but this is definitley not a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: mashuralam
Reviews.Content: Check-in was fast, our room was ready and available for early check-in. Hotel buffet breakfast was a bit pricy. You can opt for breakfast at Starbucks, Coffee Bean & McDonald's, which are very close to the hotel, about 3 minutes walk. 7eleven store, money exchange, resturants, fast foods, Orchard Road malls are very near. Hotel rooms are clean, service is good. Cons: No free wi-fi in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and reasonnable deal”
Reviews.Author: Courche
Reviews.Content: Very convenient and nice set up. Delicious breakfast buffet. Rooms are spacious.

Reviews.Title: “It ticked all the boxes!”
Reviews.Author: bootscooter55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just visited our daughter and son in law for 1 week who moved to Singapore 2 months ago and we all came for Christmas here. This hotel is in great location, walking distance to all shops in orchard road, taxis outside. We booked the club lounge and strongly recommend this! It included Buffett and a la carte breakfast, cocktails 6-8pm with delicious canapés, afternoon tea from 3-4pm, free Internet, 2 free pieces of laundry everyday!, shoe shine, paper daily, soft drinks 24/7 in the lounge.. My husband used the gym everyday and had it to himself! I opted for the spa and steam room which I also had to myself. The room was serviced whenever we asked and they had a turn down service every night with a little cake. One fabulous feature of this hotel is the abundance of free bottled water everywhere you went, in the gym, in the room,in the computer room,in the club lounge etc... One night the general manager introduced himself to us and asked how he could improve our stay, we struggled to come up with something but my husband quickly came up with wifi in the room. To our surprise the next morning, free wifi was installed! How is that for service? Would stay here again def. it's walking distance to the Tanglin club and American clubs. My husband did have a few propositions from the ladies of the night walking back to the hotel a few times, whenever I wasn't around, hahaha The night safari bus station was around the corner in orchard road and Harry's bar was fun to hang around and check out the Aussies!

Reviews.Title: “Good location near Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: LSV68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orchard Pan Pacific in Dec. The hotel is well located near Orchard Road. We travel with 2 kids, aged 8 and 6 so we stayed at Pacific suites. They charge extra for roll away beds, a steep 120 SGD a night so the kids shared the sofa which worked well. We did all main sites and locations: For universal studios the Express pass was excellent decision as the Park was super busy. Biggest hassle were the incredible queues at Night safari, over 2 hour wait just to get into the Park, but it was peak dates at Xmas we were told. Singapore works well with kids, and Orchard Pan pacific is a good base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Did not deliver as Promise”
Reviews.Author: Legendlowe
Reviews.Content: I went to stay there in Late April this year 2011 and booked through my Corporate's travel agency for an Executive Club room that costs more than $400 a night. Unfortunately the fridge was leaking and the switches to the bedside are malfunction. Hence the General Manager wrote me an apology email promising to upgrade me to a Suite if I return again. After thinking it over and decided to give it a second chance, hence when I flew to Singapore again 2 weeks ago in December, I replied to the General Manager's email, informing him of my time and day of arrival. He replied promptly and said my room would be ready when I arrive. Unfortunately this is not the case, When I arrived in that morning, the Receptionist at the Check-in desk said my room was not ready even though I told him the GM promised the room would be ready HE even said the system did not show my previous stay's record in May this year. At one stage, he asked when I a local. Why would I stay in a hotel for three nights at more than $400 a night if I'm a local??? My advance hotel booking should showed I'm from Australia. To make matter worse, when I returned at 2p.m., at the Reception desk, I did ask HIM again whether I was getting the Suite as his GM promised, He replied 'Oh yes'. When I was taken to the room, I straight away recognised that was the same room I stayed and paid for previously (EXECUTIVE CLUB ROOM), not the Suite as promised. He must be thinking I could not differentiate an EXECUTIVE CLUB ROOM with a SUITE! I was really disappointed and feel cheated to lure back to stay at this hotel again, with promise not delivered. The worse part was on check-in, I was treated like a second class citizen as if I was lying to say your GM promised to upgrade me to a Suite. Then on departure day, as I paid for an EXECUTIVE CLUB ROOM, the check-out time can be at 3p.m. I did inform the desk that I would check-out at 3p.m. Guess what, when I returned from shopping at 2p.m., both my access card were rejected from entry into my room and my internet access was also disconnected!!!! Luckily the housekeeping lady was on the floor so I asked her to let me in as she recognised me as the guest who had given tips for making the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great food!”
Reviews.Author: VanyaRohanGupta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on Orchard Road, so shopping is a delight. But the MRT station is a bit of a walk. The restaurant offers great food and the service is also very good. You must opt for breakfast as they have a great spread. The whole hotel's ambiance is great in black and gold.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant stay..”
Reviews.Author: nuttyflyinhigh
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is gr8... its just off orchard road... the MRT s close by too... food s awesome... the breakfast buffet s way better than many other 5 star property s ... the only flaw s they dont have Lcd tv s in the room... if ur plannin to spend most of ur time out doors dat shud not bother...

Reviews.Title: “excellellent place”
Reviews.Author: swatirana
Reviews.Content: great ambiance great hospitality.. "We had a marvelous stay in pan pacific orchard Hotel. Wonderful interiors, very good service and excellent dining too, it was pleasure staying in the hotel . would surely recommend for further stay

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Hubbleys
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well positioned for orchard road, staff are very efficient, food is good, rooms are very dated, how many tho rated hotels today do not have flat screen tvs, well this one does not just old small screened . Other than that Ok

Reviews.Title: “Short night but it works”
Reviews.Author: moobaby214
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night, checked in late and out early the next morning. Rate was good S230 so decided to try the hotel out. Check in was fast and prompt. Room booked was a twin bed room. Beds are in fact small but comfortable. The room itself could use updating. The TV is a very old style with a small screen. There is no WIFI In the room so you must use the LAN cable. Bathroom was fine, shower pressure good. The pool looked nice from my room. Overall it was a quiet night with no noise. The rooms could use a make over but for S230 on Orchard road the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: discerningtraveler11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights recently and the level of service was excellent. We were hotel bound for most of the day as the seasonal rains thundered down and hence spent most of our time in the lobby bar. The staff in the Lobby bar in particular Farrah, Twinkle and Mariquel made the experience a real pleasure with their friendly manner and sense of fun. The overall stay was very enjoyable and I would recommend this hotel for service and location.

Reviews.Title: “I dont think they changed my bedsheets. The pillows had lingering stale smell.”
Reviews.Author: SharinaS
Reviews.Content: Overall it's ok. Have a good basic gym that's fit for purpose, and self operated, open 24 hrs a day. The pool is okay too. Breakfast spread is satisfactory. Location is next to Orchard Road and 2 km away from Botanical Gardens. No wifi service in the room, so not good for those like me who rely on my ipad for work and internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: kaybradj
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Pan Pacific Orchard. Location is good right at the end of Orchard Rd so if you are want to be close to the shopping it's a good bet. Compared to many other Singapor hotels of comparable quality it is also pretty good value. We stayed in a suite room which gave us access to the Club Lounge which was a nice touch. All day snacks and a happy hour. You can also have a la carte breakfast too. Rooms are pretty good shape. The bathroom has some quirks - No towel racks and there is not a powerplug close enough to the vanity to shave or dry hair in front ogf the mirror. Iritating but not a deal breaker. Service is freindly and efficient. Average for Singapore but would reccomend as a value option.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK for a Pacific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SupsteeL
Reviews.Content: Hotel is at the end of Orchard Road. Had high expectations for a Pacific Hotel. Booked the Premier King room. Was surprise room is still having an old skool CRT TV with some channels blur. Old wooden furniture and worn out armchair. Pillows to soft even with 3 pillow stack on top on another. Had a backache and stiff neck when woke up in the morning. Ok for ONE night's stay. Nothing if compared to Pan Pacific at Marina and . Slse stay at nearby Royal Plaza on Scotts which is about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta be kidding me for the Price??”
Reviews.Author: chinesguy
Reviews.Content: For the same price point you can get a better. Outdated furnishing, Outdated shower, Outdated CRT TV. Staff is nice and friendly, but this needs to be lower on the list for the price

Reviews.Title: “My favorite business hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: dannyanb
Reviews.Content: Fairly small, reasonably situated, excellent service, the best lounge I've visited with personal and welcoming service and a great happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: keelgm
Reviews.Content: Recently had a week in Singapore on business and chose this hotel on the recommendation of a colleague. Hotel had nice rooms and was very clean. Restaurant was good. Only complaint was the lack of wifi access in the rooms - very annoying for a business traveller. Overall well worth checking out - especially if you want somewhere centrally located for the shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but no complaints”
Reviews.Author: AhWah
Reviews.Content: The hotel is value for money if u considedr the location and its facility which is in Orchard area. In terms of facility, the room is very clean, tastefully furnished and I particularly like the bed as it is firm to my exact preference. I really had a good night rest. The in room dining of gravy rice noodle was ok, but I wld hv expected the usual pickled chili or some local crackers but there was none. Just the noodle came. No real complaints I was pissed when told that wifi was not available in room only wired internet. I wemt beserk and really told teh reception off. They later sent a manager with a router and all is well. U need to ask for in room wifi, I guess.. In all, this hotel remains to be my 2nd choice only to my usual Hyatt or Marriott orchard. Otherwise, the staff is polite and I really like its cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: afadzari
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in their premier room and superior room. The rooms I stayed is located at 8th floor, which is smoking floor. Premier room: the room has right space. I stayed with two other friends. We still can sleep fine. The bed is too mushy, which I don't like. Though it's on the smoking floor, the room doesn't smell like ashtray. Furniture of the room looks outdated, the TV is still using the tube one. TV channel is basic. AC working properly. The bathroom is big, it has bath tub and shower chamber, though it looks like a bit old. Superior room: The room is small, but it has newer furniture. TV is already using LCD. Bathroom is smaller, only has shower chamber. This room also a smoking room, but it doesn't smell at all. This hotel is located at behind the orchard road, like around 5 minutes walking to the nearest MRT station. Beside the hotel, there's a 24 hours supermarket that sells imported goods, which is very useful. Cons: No free wifi. That's all.

Reviews.Title: “Not much improvement so far”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: When we visited Singapore, we used to stay in the Negara Hotel in the 80s and 90s and in later in the Meritus Negara because the hotel was less expensive than more centrally-located Orchard Road hotels. It was less expensive than the Hilton, and we booked on the Pan Pacific website to try it because we had good experiences at Pan Pacific Jakarta, Seattle, and Vancouver. Our room facing the Hilton across Orchard Road was not as large as rooms on the other side of the hotel. There was a small LCD TV on the wall, refrigerator, coffee-maker. We didn’t try the restaurants, business center, pool, or fitness center. The bed was comfortable, and there was absolutely no neighbor noise or outside noise. Pros Good name of the hotel Quiet enjoyment Jason’s supermarket is open 24 hours now Near some good restaurants such as La Strada in Shaw Centre. We didn't eat in the hotel,, and we know Pan Pacific usually has at least one great restaurant. This is in the pros section only because other reviewers observed that Orchard Towers, next door, was frequented by an anthology of pro’s. In previous years we occasionally saw fanfares of strumpets entering the famous four floors of Orchard Towers, but they looked and acted no different from their colleagues that walk Orchard Road, and they never seemed out of order. We didn’t see any Ladies of the Night on this trip, and we wouldn’t fault the hotel if we did. Cons Rooms, lobby, elevators and halls are essentially the same as Meritus Negara Hotel, but for a higher price. Wi-fi in the lobby was complicated to access with an iPhone. Don’t try to do it yourself. After I picked up a user name and password at the middle of three reception desks, a pretty and very patient waitress named Twinkle helped me set up my iPhone to use the free wi-fi in the lobby. In the shower, the hand shower is aimed at the door so often the spray gets between the door and frame, making the floor wet. Wired Internet access in the room costs extra, except if you are a member of GHA, which is free to join. No wi-fi in the room. If it’s raining, it’s a bit of a walk to the Orchard MRT station I mentioned to one staff member that I saw little difference, physically, from the old Meritus Negara, and she said a renovation is planned for early 2012. We are hopeful that the renovation will take place soon.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Pan Pacific Orchard!”
Reviews.Author: minatraje
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms for an overnight stay in Pan Pacific Orchard. We came from a cruise with Superstar Virgo and since it was my parents first time in singapore we decided to stay for another night. I was with my husband in our room... my mother in law, sister in law in one room and my mom, dad and brother in another room. We loved the hotel....The ambiance is very relaxing....its quiet and cozy....we lliked that they automatically give you water when you wait in the lobby lounge....we also liked the smell of the hotel :) Check in was a breeze....it was a bonus that the receptionist that time was a fellow Filipino. The hotel is really not that near to the malls because it is located in the far end of orchard...if you're with senior citizens and children it would be a long walk for them to go to orchard and back...we took a taxi everytime we would like to go somewhere even if in orchard malls only. The rooms were spacious and clean. Oh my only rant is that my mom's room has no toiletries... Overall we were very happy with the hotel. We would definitely go back :)

Reviews.Title: “the restaurant staff are brilliant and really spoil the kids, the location excellent”
Reviews.Author: spangey78
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 6 weeks as a family, the food in the restaurant Claymore10 (in the hotel) was always on top form, everything from oysters to currys to lobsters, the deserts were amazing and the staff cant do enough for you, the club lounge is also a wonderful bonus after a long day sightseeing. the pool is basic but the steam room and spa make up for the lack of inspiration of the pool design. The hotel is located in the heart of Orchard, perfect for shopping, restaurants night life, botanical gardens etc

Reviews.Title: “excellent!! :)”
Reviews.Author: kelay
Reviews.Content: first to to swim in a mineral water pool, it was a great experience! felt relax and rested during my stay

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: xxJazzxx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few weeks ago and really enjoyed my stay. I think I only have two complaints which were not hard to solve. First is the breakfast is extremely overpriced. Its about $40 per day which is ridiculous but Starbucks and McDonalds are only two minutes away which serve breakfast for about $5 each. The other is there seems to be a very dodgy concierge first he tried to sell us tickets to Universal Studios for $65 each and take our money on the spot when afterwards we found out its actually $85 each and we pay the company direct. We didn’t trust him at all after that so we opted to talk to the other concierges because they helped us properly and were more honest about everything. Or we asked the receptionists for help and they were even more helpful. Other than those two problems we had a great stay here. Rooms were so comfortable and housekeeping was great. The spa/sauna/pool/gym area was great. Internet rooms were great and you’re in a great location. Not in the middle of all the hustle and bustle but you are right by Orchard road and the MRT so it is easy enough to get places from there. So I would recommend staying here just beware of that concierge and you’ll be fine. I would give it a five if it wasnt for him.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Dabear1950
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on a singapore stopover. Our bill was on Checkout $355 Sing dollars and we had nothing to eat. Only thing additional we had was a three hour Internet package because for some reason this hotel is not conscious of the fact that people need to access the Internet. Wireless is only in the lobby and if you have a need to connect wirelessly instead of your room on direct connection. This hotel needs a serious upgrade. The rooms are jaded. We couldn't shut our closet once open. We were quoted for breakfast @ $55 per person. Hold the phone pan pacific. Perhaps I've lost the plot here. I know singapore is expensive but to stay in sub standard tired accommodation with very little plus is too much for me. This hotel at best is bordering on a three star and would struggle to get a 4 from me

Reviews.Title: “If only everywhere the service was like at the bar.”
Reviews.Author: Susy-1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice within a week and at both check-in it took around 30 minutes. Apart from 1 girl, the other are pretty much helpless. After complaining 2 days that the WI-FI at the lounge did not work, finally we found 1 receptionist that knew the procedure with I-phones. Rooms are pretty old, but comfortables. The Aircon shows his age and the buttons to select the temperature often got stuck (but was fixed within 5 minutes). There is no Wi-FI in the rooms, even not in the Pacific Club Rooms. The service at the Pacific Club Lounge was good, but we did not understand why staff use the lounge as a place to hold meetings. They have a business center which is poorly equipped and served by the receptionist as they have not dedicated staff. All in all, it is not comparable at all with the Pan Pacific Singapore which has exceptional service. Especially if you go for business I would select another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: NatandPaulAus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific Orchard for 7 nights, this is our fourth time at the property over several years. The service at the hotel is fantastic, when a staff member says good morning or asks how your day was its not your typical "do you want fries with that" type interaction it feels genuine. The Butler team (William, Lindsey, John and Amy) provide customer service that is some of the best I have had in a long time. The Hotels amenities are very good, the mineral pool is a highlight. We will defiantly be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: howtotraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a Singapore Airline Stayover Holiday package. The stay was good. The room is good shape, and the customer service was some of the best I've had in a long while. I was delighted that my room was ready when I arrived at the hotel at 6am, after approximately 30 hours of travel from the US.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME for so many reasons!”
Reviews.Author: CherylMiles
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at the Pan Pacific Orchard TWICE. once was for the Superstyle weekend package. i have never felt more pampered in my life. The package included access to the Pacific Club lounge, free flow drinks during happy hour and THE BEST breakfast i have ever had. My favourite treat was the foot massage in the comfort of our Pacific Room suite thanks to Ayuthaya Spa. the service at Pan Pacific Orchard is impeccable... every single staff member - from the bell hop who greeted us at the front of the hotel, to the receptionist to the service staff at the restaurants and lounge and housekeeping - made me feel truly welcomed. i am very fussy about good service, but i have absolutely NO complaints about the quality of service during my stay there. The staff wear a name tag that says "I am the Pan Pacific" and kudos are due to them for being wonderful ambassadors to the brand. i was so pleased i came back for my birthday weekend to just relax and enjoy the facilities. the pool side is great for bikini babes who just want to chill out, get a tan and swim some laps. The pillow menu which offers a whole range from buckwheat to foam pillows was also an added luxury. I had the BEST sleep at Pan Pacific Orchard and would recommend it as a wonderful weekend getaway to ANYBODY whether as a staycation for local Singaporeans or for friends coming to visit. TOP NOTCH service!!!

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coghlan
Reviews.Content: We syated in an executive room with club access for 4 nights. The room was excellent, very spacious with a fantastic bathroom. The club lounge is located on the entry level behind the check in areas and main restaurant which is unusual and sometimes noisy. Service in the lounge was excellent, thanks William and others. Overall a quality hotel in a quiet location one street behind Orchard so that is nice. Pool is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Very good location, very good service! Will certainly come back.”
Reviews.Author: FredericC0211
Reviews.Content: it was my fourth stay at Pan Pacific Orchard and one thing I can say is that being an habitual customer is acknowledged by the staff. They are very welcoming, always ready to help. The hotel is very clean, good food and its location is very good. I wanted to say a special thank you to Roy and Siva who were as usual, very helpful. I definitely recommend that hotel, though it is more expensive than hotels in other locations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: panda16465
Reviews.Content: A great hotel just 2 minutes walk from the shops of Orchard Road. Room was comfortable and spacious and very clean. Impeccable service from all the staff. Would definitely stay here again. (10 minute walk to the Orchard MRT).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - didnt want to go home”
Reviews.Author: Traveller276
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Executive room and the additonal space was well worth the extra money. Separate area to sit in. Everything about our stay was fantastic. Staff are friendly and effiecient. The staff in the Club Lounge were "top class" and hot coffee with the wake up call - a luxury. Pool area is very nice - could do with a newer treadmill to replace one of the two available. If you turn right when leaving the hotel at night you will avoid the "entertainment area" if you are worried about it. The 24 hour supermarket to the left of the hotel is a surprise. Different from the front. Very modern and lots of choice. Chemist also in there. I wont stay anywhere else now. We travel to Singapore each year for a week. Special thanks to the Butler Team...

Reviews.Title: “We'll certainly stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: gunawanjahja
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a quiet area but only a stone's throw from busy Orchard Road. As such, guests are not disturbed by traffic noise. Beds and pillows are very comfortable. Cleanliness is excellent, both in the rooms and lobby area. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Checking in and out was a pleasant experience, with individual desks instead of a long counter like in most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: littlemisssmokey
Reviews.Content: When we gotnto the hotel after a 12 hour flight we were very disappointed with our room more 2 star than 5. After complaining we were eventually moved to a much better room. The location is quite good apart from running the gauntlet of 'girls' on the corner before you get to the hotel - this was not good.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Nuraisha
Reviews.Content: Stayed at one of the suites over the weekend. The suite had an oriental theme to it and the bathroom was extremely spacious (almost half the size of the bedroom!) but we felt that the furnishings made the room look quite dark and dull. TV channels were quite extensive but surprisingly no MTV. The swimming pool is apparently the first in Singapore to use mineral water but it looks quite dated and in need of a total revamp. Location wise, it is less than 10mins walk to the main stretch of Orchard Road and Scotts Road. What we loved most is that guests staying at the suites are entitled to complimentary refreshments at the executive lounge and are even allowed to bring a partner each for the pre-dinner cocktail. Also, the breakfast is served hot as the main dish is to be ordered a la carte while the rest is buffet style. As for service, it would have been nice if the front desk could have been a little friendlier and spoken more articulately (as we had a hard time catching what she was saying); and if the in-house phone operator was less curt. Other than that, we have no complaints and had a pretty pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location”
Reviews.Author: AHMED_A_A
Reviews.Content: the room was clean the staff were good the food was also good but we had a problem with the location, if you want to go to orchard road you will have to pass by orchard towers (just read the rest about it on wikipedia)

Reviews.Title: “Best improved hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel many times when it was the Meritus Nagara and was apprehensive about coming back. But what a change! A complete makeover on the rooms and public areas, but most importantly the staff approach is transformed. Courteous, helpful, customer-focused and eager ti go the extra mile. I have stayed twice this year, in April and again now, and on both occasions have been impressed by the new approach. I'd recommend upgrading to a club room as this gives free acess to the lounge, inclusive breakfast and a free cocktail hour each evening. In particular among the management, I'd single out Mr Justin Style for particular praise for his sincere approach and for making every effort to allocate me a room I was happy with.

Reviews.Title: “FIVE STARS... ONLY IN THE SKY”
Reviews.Author: POMMYOU
Reviews.Content: We stay in a DE LUXE CLUB ROOM and the location was over the airconditionner rooftop next door so very noisy because the windows don't have double glass....the room smells dust coming from the carpet and the air con maybe never clean...Bathroom nice with separate shower but toilet in the middle of the bathroom and room with a very good size.... Happy hours at the club room very nice but breakfast better in the other one because not a lot of choice in the club room restaurant.. Free internet for the club rooms in the business center Anyway very good location for this Hotel but price must be manage

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: buihuongtra
Reviews.Content: My flight was delay so I came to hotel so late (about nearly 5.00am) but the receptionist so warmly welcome us and gave to me from Butler's letter to take me to some special free service such as: free international breakfasts, free wifi in room and lobby, free cocktail anytime at Pacific Club Lounge....and I was more suprised when I entered the room: a plate of fresh fruits was ready on the table and a little gift on the bedroom. Housekeeper is so quite and proffessional....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SalvadoreCapeTown
Reviews.Content: My partner an i stayed here on a 2 day lay over to Phuket. We celebrated our wedding anniversary and were upgraded to a cityscape room. The room was fantastic with everything we needed. We were also provided with a lovely chocolate mousse cake on our anniversary. The staff were fantastic and nothing was too much trouble. Will we stay here again - a big YES!

Reviews.Title: “Not convinced”
Reviews.Author: psychoactive
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Centrally located - Fantastic breakfast buffet and in room dining (especially the choice of freeshly squeezed juices) - Some staff members are really nice! Contras: - NO WIFI (Hello ? Singapore, 1994 ?) - Pricy internet in-room cable connection - Cannot open windows in room - Airconditioning panel was broken twice (repaired on my last night) - Staff failed to arrange airport transfer despite having it wrote down in the official shuttle transfer booklet (sorted within 5 minutes, though) Overall the stay was acceptable - but service was patchy and the room was not that nice. Bottom line - Next time I would definitely stay elsewhere considering the price and the location, Orchard Road offers much better deals.

Reviews.Title: “Really out of my expectation not worth”
Reviews.Author: Timmyng425
Reviews.Content: I booked the twin room from 3 June to 7 June, it is my first day to stay, I can say that it is really poor, the furniture is too old and some broken. The single bed is really small, i never find a hotel like that. I cannot image that is a 5 star hotel, i ask for change room but refused coz I am in promotion price cannot change. it really out of my expectation, and the price is 1630 per night. Not worth at all. I will not try this hotel anymore

Reviews.Title: “Happy, Flexible and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: millionsofmiles
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Singapore for a 2 day business meeting and was really pleased with the efficient check in/out, room service and hotel meals. Staff were always available and helpful without fuss. I needed to check out as late as possible as I was booked on an 8 pm flight and has a business meeting; the hotel kindly allowed me to check out at 3PM on a complementary basis as the room was not booked for that night.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tiffykl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Pan Pacific Orchard for 3 days for business seminar. Pleasant and enjoyable all throughout. Nice rooms, great food and very helpful hotel staff. Wouldn't mind coming back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff, friendly and helpful and excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brooks71
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my friend and our respective children, aged 7 to 12. The hotel staff were fantastic, so helpful, friendly and full of information about how to get about and where to go. My friend chose the hotel as it was close to the shopping on Orchard Street and had a pool. We were within minutes of the shops but off the main road so it was quieter. We used the pool and spa facilities and towels were provided. The breakfasts were excellent with a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located hotel on Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: Bella1106
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a business trip in The Pan Pacific and it is well located on Orchard road. The rooms are a bit small but include everything you need. A big advantage of this hotel is its staff. I was sick during the stay and had to rest in the room and the personnel really made me feel home and comfortable with little nice gestures (fruit plate, free breakfast in the room, ....). The business centre of the hotel is also very good and well organised. I have not tried any restaurant but heard from my colleagues that this was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Staying there next week and already having issues”
Reviews.Author: weluv2travelabroad
Reviews.Content: I will be staying at the Pan Pacific Orchard next week for five nights on a corporate account and my company frequently sends guests here. This is the first time I will be staying at this hotel and so far am disappointed with the service. Simple requests have been declined, such as having a DVD player. I was told either to upgrade my room to get it for free (about an extra S $100) or to pay an additional charge per night. After staying in other 5 star hotels in Singapore and many other cities, I can definitely say that this small request should have been met. I just hope that the hotel is more accommodating when I get there as I will be staying for five days.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: traveller78_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Pacific Club Room, big and spacious, with complimentary access to the Pacific Club Lounge with all-day refreshments and evening cocktails! The staff were warm and friendly, address me by name, made me feel like a VIP. The complimentary kids amenities my little ones really liked too, and the swimming pool - the front office lady told me it was mineral water pool, so very healthy to skin. They also have sauna and jacuzzi at no charge, but i was tired with the children, skipped that. We ate at 10 at Claymore, and they took great care of my two elderly, not only service staff, but also the chefs helping to their needs,explaining even the smallest details such as the various salad sauces to them very sincerely and patiently. I also saw the service staff trying their best to make conversation with the guests at other tables, without being too intrusive. I must say I was extremely impressed! This is my first time in a 5star hotel but receiving such sincere treatment and service, in its cosy surroundings, also with alot of shopping nearby. Had a very good impression, look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Attentive Service, Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kayn1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a brief stopover on the way home from Europe after a cruise, and liked everything about this hotel. However, the thing that impressed us the most was the attentiveness and consideration of the staff. No standing in a line to register. We were comfortably seated at a desk and taken through the registration procedure very efficiently by a very pleasant staff member, and given immediate access to our room, even though it was only 9 am. The room was spacious, well appointed and very comfortable. When we went to use the internet in the business section, someone immedately appeared and sheparded me on to an ajoining chair. We had inadvertantly chosen a computer not connected to a printer and couldn't print our boarding passes for the next day, but again a staff member appeared and quickly remedied the situation. The hotel is close to Orchard Road, but be sure to pick up a map with all the streets on it to avoid a longer walk back. We got a bit lost trying to find a short cut back to the hotel without retracing our steps.

Reviews.Title: “Thinking of hustle free check-in? Then don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Joeyweternal
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel room through Flight Center. My flight arrived at Singapore passed midnight and we were very exhausted. After reach the hotel, there was only one receptionist present and unfortunately for us, she was attending another couple. So we patiently waited, but despite seeing us with luggage clearly indicating that we are guests, she did not even call in for help. So we have to wait for another 20 mins until finally another staff showed up and asked us “what can I do for you?” The check-in process took over 40 mins, despite I presented her all the original printouts I received from Flight Center, she insisted that I should have another set of document to give her. I told her this is all I have… eventually she said that’s okay, it’s between the hotel and flight center, they will contact the flight center to get the document… (Thank goodness, shouldn’t you think of that when we first said these were all we received from the Flight Center?) Gave her my credit card details, no problems at all (you think? Problem came later). However, it was not until we traveled to our room to found that the room has twin bed configuration, instead of one queen size bed. Despite being really tied, we went down stairs to ask if there was a mistake. We were told our booking was for twin beds (that's fine, Flight Center made an error) but when I asked if I could get an upgrade. She straight away replied no (without even checking the availability first). We said we were willing to pay extra to get an upgrade, she insisted that they don’t have any room. I asked her how about tomorrow, she insisted that they were fully booked during our entire staying period. After getting back to the hotel room, I checked their online booking system, Da Da, rooms with queen size bed available on that exact day and through out our entire stay in this hotel. I called the front desk to inform them such “news”, they blamed that the system was not up-to-date, and eventually told us that they could change us into a queen size room tomorrow but it would be much smaller… so we stayed in the twin size bed room for the entire stay. Anyway, several days later, when I checked my online credit card transactions, it showed that the hotel charged me couple hundred Australian dollars. First I thought it was the room service, so didn’t pay much attention. On my check out, they asked me to sign for the room service and buffet dinner, which are all fine, usual procedure. But then when I was at the airport using their free wi-fi service, I discovered that the room service and buffet dinner have showed up as separate payments on my online statement. I called the hotel using my mobile (on roaming) to ask what was the couple hundred dollars for? They couldn’t provide me a decent answer. They first insisted that the payment was for the room service and buffet. But I was able to show them that the room service and buffet were charged separately (by given them the exact Singapore dollar amount). They then said because it’s a Friday they can’t tell me what was the money charged for and I need to wait until Monday to contact them again. I told them I’m physically in the airport and will fly back to Australia today... Apart from their promise to solve this problem as soon as possible, no real answers received. The amount showed up in my credit card statement for over a week. Couple weeks later, finally received an e-mail from the Hotel stating that the amount was in fact a “deposit” for the anticipated cost that I MAY incur. I’ve been staying in many five star hotels around the world and this is the first time I ever been charge a deposit without my knowledge. If they were in fact deposits, then why were my meals charged separately at the end? Shouldn’t they be deducted from the deposit? Especially, How can a hotel make charges on my credit card without my signature or pin? Honesty is the key, how could a 5 star hotel, so it claims, be able to do something like that, you have lost my confident in you.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty small rooms with no wifi and dirty showers.”
Reviews.Author: traveltwin23
Reviews.Content: We were here on business travel and had this hotel recommended to us. The lobby is very nice and good location. However my room was neat but found the carpet awful and dirty, shower floor dirty and sheets had 3 hairs and mascara stains. Called down for new sheets. New sheets looked good. But when I pulled back the bed cover again with the new sheets found dirt and hairs. Called for another set. By the time they came I learned my colleagues travelling with me had similar issues. We called the manager and she tried to show us other rooms ( we already had std and deluxe rooms). We said no. She tried to charge us for 4 hours (seriously do they rent by the hour?). Eventuallly she let us leave and we moved to the hilton down the street which is lovely. I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: tinkokan
Reviews.Content: I think for the room overall better Pan Pacific Marina than Orchard . Because the room is bigger than Orchard and for the facilities is more . So , for us Pan Pacific Orchard is Λ good location . For the staff they worked very good for hotel guest ..... Overall I satisfaction with Pan Pacific Orchard .....Do the best

Reviews.Title: “Style and Professionalism Embraced in Pan Pacific Orchard”
Reviews.Author: ahindle2010
Reviews.Content: My arrival at the Pan Pacific Orchard for 6 nights was met with the warmest of welcomes which are so typical of this city. The room was a suite which meant i had acces to the Pacific Club. The room facilites and service was excellent and the staff went out of there way to be helpful if I needed anything at any time of the day. Although I ate out of the hotel many evenings, I ate at the 1' Claymore Road which is the Pan Pacific's steak house. The food and wine choice was excellent with attentive service all round. After a hard day in meetings or sight seeing I would retire to the hotel lobby bar where the excellent choice of snacks and drinks was supplemented by the friendly bar staff. I cannot thank the team enough at Pan Pacific Orchard for making my stay such a pleasant one . I hope to return later in the year and pick up where I left off. Kep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Reception, High Quality of Rooms, and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AndyMan_11
Reviews.Content: I liked the room and bathroom the best specially the strong shower with amenities. The ladies at the reception were friendly and responsive. The location is excellent next to the shopping malls and tour sites. The least was the wall power plug-in were 220 volts. Hotel provided me with a 120 volts plug-in adapter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and excellent restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Houseman76
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay in this hotel. Enjoyed excellent breakfast and excellent dinner on the last day. Hotel is very clean and staff is very good. Location is in the middle of the City Centre, many shopping-centers nearby. Swimmingpool and spa are of excellent quality. When I will visit Singapore again, I surely will be staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Suite”
Reviews.Author: douglas_teoh
Reviews.Content: Location is convenient to get to Singapore's shopping spot - Orchard Road. The hotel is spectacular. It was how I could imagine it through looking at the photos in their website. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, staff very friendly, service very good”
Reviews.Author: mssinko
Reviews.Content: Went to Singapore for business meetings and golf. My room was excellent, clean, great bathroom. staff were very friendly, nothing was too much trouble. I will definately be staying here on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “New old hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: DeenHanafi
Reviews.Content: Situated on Claymore Rd, off Orchard Road. Nearer if walk via the Pacific Plaza rather than the Orchard (if going to the MRT and Scotts/Orchard junction). Booked via internet booking engine, so quite good deal with breakfast for two. The only drawback is we got the smallest room. Well, does not matter as long as comfortable. Hotel lobby was dark due to its black marble. Check in was wonderful because we reached there around 11am and was given the room immediately. So, we just dropped our luggage in the room and started sightseeing. Room condition is so-so - I guess Pan Pacific is trying to do its best to ensure the room looks new. Amenities provided in the room are basic - own brand bathroom amenities, small TV (in fact it was so small that the picture got truncated from view), door lock was not working. Breakfast - nothing to shout about. One thing I like is "make your own juice" station. Just pick up any fruits available and the staff will blend/squeeze it for you. Fresh and healthy! Area wise, I was warned that the seasoned buildings next to the hotel are famous for wrong reason - my observation proved it i.e. three adult shops, couple of bars (one is named "Naughty Girl")

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money here - worst experience at the Pan Pacific Orchard”
Reviews.Author: Mango53
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Pan Pacific Orchard for 3 nights at the tail-end of a 2 week holiday across Malaysia and Singapore and its ended our trip on a bad note. I have never encountered such rude and shocking service in my life. The front desk staff are surly and sullen, I do not think they realize they are working in hospitality! I have broken it down by Service, Hotel Location and Room. Feel free to contact me via TA if you want any further info: SERVICE: Check-in was with Najal or Najar, no smile, no welcome, or hello. During our entire interaction there was barely any eye contact she spoke to the computer screen the whole time. We were checking in at 9pm so thought it may have just been a long day for her. We used the pool facilities on the 2nd day and my fiancé stayed behind to use the gym while I returned to the room and did not realize you need a swipe card between that floor and the rooms (sometimes you only need a card from reception not within the hotel). He went down to reception and got Najal/Najar again, and explained the situation and asked for a temporary card. She asked “what is your room number” and when he told her she looked at her computer and replied ‘you check out tomorrow’. Okay...that’s great – does that mean he can wait until we check out tomorrow? She then handed him a card without looking up, ahh it was just a blunt comment to make rather than actually being nice or making conversation. On the 3rd day I checked my emails for the hotel confirmation as I did not want to ring down and deal with them to confirm checkout time for the 4th day. My reservation email confirmed a guaranteed late check-out of 3pm (I just checked and this is also emblazoned across the official website). On our way out I stopped by the front desk and spoke to Danielle. I asked her to check our checkout time please. She checked and replied 12pm. I said (and I was being overly friendly too, just to compensate for their sourness) my email said 3pm. She rolled her eyes and looked on the computer and said deadpan ‘I can give you 2pm’ and types it without any acknowledgement from me. I replied ‘I can go and print out the email, my reservation says 3pm?’ and she said bluntly ‘the latest anyone gets is 2pm, we have to charge if you stay past 2pm’. I felt like she was calling me a LIAR. By now I would have looked annoyed and told her I will go use the business centre and print out the email as proof. I found it completely unprofessional to not honour a confirmed reservation - I did not even request it the late checkout, it was an incentive to book on the official website! I may as well have booked through Wotif and saved a bit of cash. She then replied ‘fine its 3pm’ typing on the computer without any eye contact and then kept looking on her computer. No ‘anything further I can help with, apologies for the misunderstanding’, no acknowledgement. It was like I did not exist standing in front of her! I could not believe this is the service at a 5 star hotel. Every single exchange with the front desk staff left a sour taste in my mouth. I am dreading checkout this afternoon, AT 3PM! My fiancé and I were discussing this in the lift and another guest agreed, the service here is abysmal. LOCATION: A 5mins hilly walk RIGHT to Scotts Rd (you end up next to Royal Plaza on Scotts – which I am kicking myself we didn’t book as it was the same price) and then 2mins to Orchard Rd. Or a shorter 3min walk LEFT direct to Orchard Rd but through sex shops and massage parlours. Definitely not recommended for families with kids or older guests. For the same 5mins walk but cheaper, I would recommend the York Hotel which has been completely renovated and although still a hilly walk it’s a quiet driveway through a park, and not via a road used by taxis or a red light district building. There is a free shuttle provided by the Paragon shopping centre that takes you down to the heart of Orchard Rd but it’s a 25min trip and stops at other hotels, hardly convenient. ROOMS: The size is decent, but feels like a light refurbishment rather than a full renovation. The carpet smells musty, the bathroom still shows its age. The furniture is dark and the walls are stark white, they would have done well to paint it some warmer colours or at least have one picture or painting. There is a small CRT tv and no dvd player. Feels like a 3 star hotel, nothing 5 star about it. No wifi, but free broadband if you sign up as a Pan Pacific member at reception. Gym facilities are fine, the pool area needs renovating, pool chairs are looking tattered. Spa and sauna area is clean. There is nothing that would compel me to ever stay or recommend the Pan Pacific Orchard to anyone. There are too many other hotels around that actually appreciate their guests. For the 5 star prices you can get a lot better around the Orchard Rd area. And if money is an issue, Singapore has such an efficient MRT service, as long as you stay close to an MRT and then take an MRT directly into Orchard, you will end up in a shopping centre faster than staying at the Pan Pacific Orchard. Every other hotel we stayed in the last 2 weeks were fantastic or if there were some losses had some redeeming features that would make me return. The Pan Pacific Orchard location and rooms are not good enough to warrant such average service. For the crappy service and basic rooms we may as well have been in a 3 or 4 star business hotel. A disappointing end to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and trendy room”
Reviews.Author: icypen
Reviews.Content: I booked the pacific club room with the intent of celebrating my bf's birthday. I'm glad that i've chosen the pacific club room that comes with pacific club privileges. After telling them that i'm celebrating a birthday (enquire via their website), they provided a complimentary cake, which was tasty. Ms Michelle, the Assistant Guest Relations Manager, even suggested some other arrangements to make my stay n celebration even more special. Thanks! My bf was pleasantly surprised by them. The club room is spacious, has a sitting area, bed is comfortable though i din sleep well. The toilet is tastefully designed. Trendy. You dun have to bring your own toiletries cause theirs are fantastic -loccitane range. From basic necessities like conditioner to body lotion, and even bath salt and loofah. U will really enjoy ur bath. The mineral water pool is great. Even pigeons visit the pool to quench their thirst! Fitness centre is small, with only a few machines. Beside the centre, there is a jaccuzi, steambath and sauna area. Quite private. Towels are provided there. Cocktails is served from 6-8pm @ pacific club lounge, with some delicious snacks. Morning breakfast is served there too. You have a choice of hot breakfast. Portion is quite generous. Try the french toast. Bananas sandwiched by two french toast. Yummy! Overall, the stay is great if not for the uphill walk to the hotel. Receptionist can be more friendly. The access cards given to us initially din work, thus request to change another one. Seems this is not unusually. Heard it from another guest who helped us with the card.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms with small tv”
Reviews.Author: alanyeo76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during one of the weekend. Room is small and the tv is even smaller. No bath tub in the room. Location got nothing to shout about as it takes about 15 to 30 Minutes to walk to the main shopping area in orchard. The lobby lounge is quite nice though. Had the wagyu beef burger and its pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel located back of an awsomeeeee street”
Reviews.Author: vijit
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located just 2 mins from the main street Orchard Road which is best for shopping, leisure, night life. This is the best street in Singapore one can stay in. though it is just 5 mins outside the main city but you just need to go there for for Tours only. Cabs are very expensive in Singapore, try to manage thru trains which is very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DipakM
Reviews.Content: Just off Orchard Road, so you have privacy and quiet, this hotel has a laid back charm. The rooms are nice and large. The beds are reasonably comfortable and the bathrooms are pretty well appointed. The property looks a little old and resigned to its fate. You have these old CRT TVs which take you back a couple of decades. The staff were courteous and helpul without being obtrusive. WIFI is not free and this was a pain. The wine selection at the lobby restaurant is quite extensive and reasonably priced. They had a special steak worth SD 70 which did not quite live up to its reputation !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel of choice in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Petermcau
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific Orchard Hotel in Singapore should be on everyone's list of preferred hotels in Singapore, the ambience, staff, and quality of service in all areas makes the experience very pleasurable. As a regular visitor to Singapore, whether on business or pleasure, I always stay at the PPO and would recommend it above any other to anyone who asks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Ymint
Reviews.Content: I travelled here with colleagues on a business trip and took my teenage daughter with me. We were a bit confused at first as the check in desks were different to the regular check in counter in other hotels, but it was a nice way to check in. The rooms were nice and comfortable and the location was good as soon as we'd worked out the short-cut to Scotts road. The buffet breakfast was very nice and catered to a wide range of tastes. All in all this was a charming hotel and a nice location. I would definitely like to stay again. This was my daughter's first trip to Asia and she enjoyed staying at the hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Stay here again if I go back to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Rowena3008
Reviews.Content: I had four nights here with my adult daughter when we came over for a quick holiday for shopping and sightseeing. I had no idea of where to stay and it seemed the more people I talked to the more confused I got. We found the location excellent. It cost us S$18 from Changi Airport in the taxi to get there. It took us about 25 minutes. The hotel is just off Orchard Road so within a two minute walk we were in the heart of shopping. PPO is located at the top (or bottom end?) of Orchard Road so it was really good to start at one end, cross over and do the other side- not that you could possibly do that in one day to see all the shops. We found we were up too early and had to wait until shops opened - some around 10 but really it was mainly 11-am when they all opened. We were on the 18th floor with a pleasant enough view over the city. However, we weren't there to look out the window so that wouldn't have worried us about the view. Our room was extremely clean with two single beds (as requested on Wotif). Our rate included buffet breakfast which was really extensive, catering for all food needs. There was plenty to choose from and the staff were most efficient and quick with service. The foyer/restaurants were very modern and well maintained. The breakfast really set us up well for the full days we had and we really didn't need to eat again until dinner. The bathrooms were great with shower and bath, with well stocked bathroom extra's. A tip here, if you joined up with the Hotel Club (free) you got free internet in your room during your stay, which was a real bonus as its normally charged out at S$5 per hour. Once on Orchard Road, there were bus stops all along. A couple of times, we hoped on any bus that came by (as they all travel down the full length of Orchard Road) and hoped off about 2 - 3 stops down. It made it easier in the heat to get to new shops. We purchased a three day Singapore Pass which was excellent value. For S$8 per day, we hoped on any bus or train we wanted and we used it often. There may have been a cheaper option but hey, for S$8 for a whole day in this city, I was not going to go hunting anything else down to save a couple of bucks. You just swipe on and off and travel where ever you want. We purchased ours from the ticket office at the ION station. It came with a handy map. The closest MRT station was at the ION station which we got to just across the road (via the underpass). The MRT was exceptionally easy to understand, and if lost, there were easy to find information counters and the staff spoke excellent English and their directions were great. The trains come by every few minutes, the longest we waited was perhaps 6 minutes. The system was very well run and the trains were exceptionally clean and had a safe feel to them, no matter what time of the day or night. ION shopping was excellent and we shopped there a lot. It had all the main shops you find anywhere in the world and we felt prices were similar (perhaps slightly cheaper) than Australia, however an enormous selection. There were probably cheaper places to go, but in the 34 degree heat, we were happy to stay in the malls which were well air-conditioned. We did the Hop On Hop Off tour which was fantastic, S$23 pp. There was a stop for this about 300 metre walk from the hotel. We did the full Orange route, then hopped off and did the full Red route. It was an excellent way of getting to know the locations. As it was so hot, one afternoon we decided to stay in and have a few hours at the pool and work on our tan. The pool was great with nice sun loungers, but the sun goes in the opposite way to Australia and the sun had gone behind the building by 1pm so no tanning was done, even though it was over 30 degrees! :-( If I was to return to Singapore I would definitely stay back at the PPO and I highly recommend it as a very good 4 - 41/2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not a hotel I'd choose again”
Reviews.Author: 5StarAirline
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was supposedly on Orchard Road close to the main shopping areas. It isn't far, but there are closer hotels to the main action (e.g. Marriott). The Pan Pacific is located near the end of the Orchard Road shops a couple of blocks from the main shopping area, and is on the road behind and parallel to Orchard Road. It isn't a long walk at all to the main shopping area (perhaps 5 minutes) but you need to walk through an area of sex shops and prostitutes. My Dad (who is retired) was asked if he wanted business after returning to the hotel one evening! I heard a number of other guests also discussing this in the lobby. That said, I never felt the area was unsafe and I'd have no problem walking back to the hotel, even late at night. My biggest issue with this hotel is the comfort of the mattress and the quality of the linens. The mattress feels very thin and is very hard. I don't know if it is an orthopaedic mattress, or just a cheap one, but either way I didn't really enjoy my sleep each night. The beds are made so the sheets don't quite tuck into the foot end properly, so each morning I found the sheets pulled messily pulled from the bed and myself tangled up in them all with the mattress exposed. Overall, not the sort of bed I dream of coming home to and snuggling down into. Lobby is a pleasant place to have a drink (drinks are very expensive though) and breakfast buffet was good. However, on all the days I was at the hotel, the hotel was hosting conferences or accommodation for a number of large business groups. Whilst these presented no problem in terms of noise or inconvenience, it did ruin the ambience somewhat to see big groups of business associates hanging around as I was on holiday and wanted to forget about business. The hotel is decorated in dark wood and gold - quite colonial in feel. Lifts are fast and efficient, never had to wait. It has a small almost boutique feel to the place. Spa looks awesome - very plush, and the mineral water swimming pool was nice as there is no chlorine in the water. However, I was not so impressed with the actual spa treatment itself. The lobby of the spa and demonstration room looked very plus and impressive, but the treatment room I was assigned was a bit tatty and basic. Also, the actual massage itself was not so good. Internet in the rooms is via cat5 cable only (no wi-fi) but it is nice and fast. 4Mbps average download and 10ms ping. Wi-fi is available in the lobby but you need to get a voucher from front-desk to use this. They gave me free vouchers but said each time it should normally be chargeable as it is separate from the room Internet charge. Overall, because of the uncomfortable beds and poor linen, I would not recommend this hotel unless it was significantly cheaper than others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute pleasure.....Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Dicksy61
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the PanPacific Orchard for 5 days and I have to say it was an absolute pleasure.The staff are very informative , friendly and only too willing to help in any way. The room we had was extremely clean and always well serviced with plenty of space for luggage and clothes etc. The hotel is only a two minute walk from Orchard Road and is conveniently placed to numerous restaurants and night life. I would recommend this hotel as a clean , friendly and fantastic place to spend your holiday or business trip. Dave.......WESTERN AUSTRALIA

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hooksey91
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to Singapore and stayed in an Executive rooms for six nights and enjoyed our stay at this great hotel. Rooms were very spacious and clean. Staff were very freindly and helpful. Excellent value in the Executive Lounge for Breakfast and Drinks. Overall a great experiance and will definetly be staying during my next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: sunzhinzd
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this hotel during Idul Fitri , Islamic holidays. This was a perfect experience to stay at this hotel. Actually i booked a deluxe room and i checked in at 10pm but i'm really surprised that i got is a really big big room and very complete things that may be needed for travelling. It's just a nice experience that the staff were friendly and helpful too. The breakfast was nice too, so much choices and tasteful. the bed was excellent so i got the perfect sleep. That's my awesome experience with PPO. Great job guys. Keep it up and thanks for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Orchard road hotel - without the noise”
Reviews.Author: nora1379
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Convenient location. Great service. Would recommend to travellers that want convenience without the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best”
Reviews.Author: traveller7682
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in many countries but this is the best hotel that I have ever stayed.Its clean,comfortable,staffs are friendly,rooms are clean and the beds and pillows are awesome.I really loved the bathroom mainly because of the hot shower and the water pressure.After a long hour tour visitting the attractions in Singapore this is the kind of hotel that everyone should be looking for because the environment and feelings is as same as walking in to your own home.The breakfast was delicious and awesome.Plenty of varities and the freshly squeezed fruit juices is so perfect to start your day.Very near to main shopping outlets,walking distance to MRT stations that basically takes you wherever you want to go and just wait within 2 to 3 minutes at the hotel lobby and the Bell boy will be arranging for a Taxi for you.When I travel again to Singapore,I will definitely stay in Pan Pacific Orchard again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, definantly return”
Reviews.Author: chrissie_payne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of the Singapore Stopover. It is based just round the corner from the shops, but still manages to maintain a quiet atmosphere. Our room was lovely, nothing extravagent, but really comfortable. Nice size bathroom with a lovely shower. We had breakfast and the odd evening meal. Really nice. Staff are very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. My only gripe which is a real shame, they charge for Internet. All the hotels in New Zealand had been FOC. However, I would return.

Reviews.Title: “This is not Pan Pacific Singapore :(”
Reviews.Author: charmedmac
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I was in a rush to book and the rating here trip advisor was pretty good. Also, I stayed in pan pacific Singapore two years ago and it was an overall pleasant experience. The first frontliner who attended to us was not very friendly at all. I booked this room on line and even if I specified that we needed 2 twin beds in the room, deluxe rooms apparently have one queen bed only. My colleague and I ended up sleeping in one queen bed. The room itself was small but clean enough. Very basic for the price. The air-conditioning unit fluctuated and got warm in the evening. The location is a bit misleading because it is not actually on orchard road but on an adjacent street. It was near shopping areas but you have to walk pass by what the taxi driver called "hookers hotel" or something like that. And I did notice the "red light district" where women were picking up men. Not actually premium. Room service sucked. The food was really bad. The fish sticks had that bad fishy taste that left a bad taste in my mouth. The bellhop was friendly enough though.
