Service was good in the restaurants and the frontliner who assisted us during the check out was nice. The rest if the staff were stiff and unfriendly. And lastly. Not free wifi! :( Overall, I would not recommend this to anyone. My stay in the other pan pacific was way way better.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were fantastic. Beautiful pool.”
Reviews.Author: MSambidge
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific Orchard seemed more of an upmarket business hotel than a holiday stopover. Having said that, would definitely choose it again and it was certainly peaceful which was at the top of my priority list for a good night's sleep. The staff were wonderful, in particular at the restaurant desk. Beautiful outdoor pool. Everything we needed complete with minimart next door. In the lobby staff were on hand for lending umbrellas (which we needed every day!). The breakfast and dinner buffets were fantastic and probably wasted on us! Location: short walk to Orchard Road and bus stops. Just a small point: bathroom sink was cracked and could do with updating.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific Orchard”
Reviews.Author: ThK2010
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern and good hotel. Rooms wer not huge, but also not too small. I didn't use restaurant, just accomodation and bar in the lobby. Since World Football Championship 2010 had just begun, I liked the large cinema at the bar and some special offerings while watching some of the matches. Hotel and bar prices are not cheap, but more or less fair. Location is nearby Orchard Road and not far from some large shopping centres (good for food).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but you can do better for the price”
Reviews.Author: Anna1834
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the suites for one night before moving to the Pan Pacific Singapore. The club access was nice, although the breakfast spread in the restaurant looked better than the a la carte menu we had in the club lounge. The hotel itself is not very flash- for example the pool area isn't that nice and the view was nothing special- but is comfortable and well located (the nearby Orchard Towers presents no problems what so ever). The suite we were in was huge and quite nice, however the furniture was a little dated and I'm not sure this hotel was worth the price we payed. The service wasn't up to scratch but overall it was a good experience. We had a booking for the rest of our stay at the Pan Pacific Singapore (their other hotel on the other side of town)...which was sensational.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay and a memorable experience!”
Reviews.Author: Rene1356
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the convenient location - eateries and shopping within walking distance, easy access to mrt, and shuttle service from hotel to famous drop zones e.g. Paragon and Mandarin Gallery. Commendable hotel staff for their great hospitality, attentiveness and were helpful throughout our stay, especially "JJ" and his crew at "10@Claymore". An impression indeed. Keep up the excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Customer Service, Great Location, Spa Amazing!!"”
Reviews.Author: Schnucs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and everything was wonderful from check in to departure. I arrived early in the morning and there was no problem with checking into a room. I asked for a quiet room (i.e. away from obvious noises, lift, bars, function rooms etc) and that was no problem. Someone arrived to my door as soon as I was unpacked to see if I had laundry which if I had could have been returned that evening, excellent for travellers stopping over for a short stay. Breakfast buffet was excellent, room service was very good. Some extras in hotel were a little more expensive than I expected. I used the spa for a jet lag reviver massage and it was by far the best massage I have ever experienced, followed by a cup of the most beautiful tea I have ever tasted (Matoom tea)! If thats not enough to convince the hotel is 1-2 mins walk from Orchard Road where all the shops are and there is a 24 hour convenience store next door just in case.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly would come back again!”
Reviews.Author: billHK
Reviews.Content: Good location, nearby Orchard Road. Friendly staff both in the lobby and in the restaurant. Check-in/check-out efficient and comfortable, was offered a seat instead of standing in front of the counter. Ample supply of pillows with different size, very impressive. Much delighted with the complimentary airport transfer in a limousine.

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: RichandSue62
Reviews.Content: Charming staff, comfortable, clean rooms, spacious bathroom with nice toilettries, big bed with lots of pillows, pool with bar service, quiet location but only a few minutes walk to Orchard Road and the SHOPPING! OK, the TV is miniscule, but who goes on holiday to watch TV, and the food (restaurants, lobby & minibar) exorbitantly priced but the markets are close and there are 7/11 stores only metres away. This was our second and by no means last stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: muchlishakim
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the hotel on 19-21 June 2010. The location is on claymore street, a residence area behind orchard road. The outside of the hotel seemed a bit outdated, but in the inside was modern, nice, and warm. The hotel is using 3 reception tables instead of 1 big, long desk. Room was nice with a big comfy bed and many pillows. Too bad my room has CRT TV, not the LCD one. Perhaps because we stayed at deluxe room not the higher class room. Bathroom is spacious with separate shower and bathtub. Breakfast was good but not variety as other 5-stars hotel, the waitress were so friendly. They even made a hot chocolate for my son though that's not on the buffet menu. The busy orchard road is just minutes walking. But unfortunately there are some night clubs behind the hotel and many girls standing on the street offering "a date". So it's a bit uncomfortable to walk at night with your family. But in overall it's a nice a hotel and I'd love to stay here again for my next holiday in singapore....

Reviews.Title: “Well done again!”
Reviews.Author: Kenn_1969
Reviews.Content: When i come to Singapore, I stay at the Pan Pacific Orchard. I have yet to have even a slight "problem". I travel alot and this location has been by far the best place where I stay. When I return to Singapore I will definately stay here again. The hotel is child friendly, comfortable, and clean. The service is fantastic and the food is great.

Reviews.Title: “Not up there with other Pan Pacifics”
Reviews.Author: Eagletrana
Reviews.Content: I stayed here four nights from April 27th to May 2nd. Had stayed here earlier in Novermber 2009. This time was a mistake as I had wanted to check into to Pan Pacific Marina but my office goofed up!! I had originally booked for two nights but then extended and asked for the weekend deal that included an upgrade and free breakfast. But when I checked in I found that while my stay had been extended it had been extended at the old terms, so no upgrade and no breakfast!! Spent an unpleasent 15 minutes talking to the check in staff was finally reluctantly given breakfast. I had the smallest room category, they are pretty small. Stay i the bigger room. The bathrooms are large and have a seperate shower cubicle and tub, but the hotel, formerly the Negara, is beginning to show its age and no where is it more apparent than in the bathrooms...slightly grotty, black lichen like growth in the corners. The furnishing and carpetings need an overhaul. Overall the hotel is slightly dark. The breakfast was average and the dining area very certainly not Five Star, it took awhile to get the tables cleaned etc. Ate breakfast only day there as I had a business meeting otherwise walked out to Ochard road to grab a coffee at the loads of places in the are. The hotel boats of a minderal water pool, which I didn't use.....but the gym was pretty basic..thats a problem I have had at a lot of Sinapore hotels though....The gymat the Conrad for instance where I stayed in March 2008 was again not what you would expect at a Conrad....the best I have had at Singapore was the Ritz Carlton, but even the gym at a hotel of a far lower grade like the Adelphi Suites in Bangkok is better than most Five Star Gyms in Singapore hotels. The location is excellent, just off orchard road. It is next to the infamous Orchard Towers but there is noting in your face so its okay. All in all pretty good value for money, but for a little more there a far better places to stay at in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Great Service ... Must Stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: meher_kt
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Pan Pacific Orchard for 4 night on my Honeymoon Trip between 20th and 24th May 2010. Everything in this hotel is just perfect for all type of travellers. Its location is the best in Singapore. A 24 hour departmental store is a just a step away. Singapore's main shopping and entertainment district in just 2 min walk from the Hotel Lobby. MRT station is 5-7 minutes walking and i recommend all leisure travellers to use the MRT instead of the Taxis to understand and enjoy the city to the max... Breakfast buffet is superb with great choice but they ideally should change the menu frequently for travellers staying longer than 1 to 2 days. Service during the buffet and room service were top class with no complaints at all. We loved our stay in Pan Pacific Orchard and would love to return on our next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Although a chain it felt like a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Virginia3960
Reviews.Content: We had a Club Room and it is terrific value - large room, beautiful bathroom and toiletries and all day access to the Club Lounge plus a "happy Hour" from 6 - 8 pm. Breakfast in Club Lounge included with a lovely buffet and you could order a hot breakfast from the menu. Great food in hotel restaurant - if you get a chance talk to Guy the Food & Beverage Manager. marvellous location - whizz out the back lobby and you are in Orchard Road - a shopper's paradise. Only downside the back rooms are impacted by music late into the night from a nearby night club - get one of the rooms facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “High standard and affordable”
Reviews.Author: akraghb
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Singapore but I was told that the prices certainly were competable especially considering the high standard of the rooms and the level of service. Shopping facilities in the area were also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Offers the best value for money in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: DrumStevenageUK
Reviews.Content: My work takes to Singapore many times and finding a good hotel at a reasonable price is not always easy, but now having stayed there 3 times I find the Pan Pacific Orchard the ideal choice. it's a recent new hotel, very modern, great rooms and ideally placed for Orchard road in Central Singapore. Its ideal for both business and pleasure, the staff are very good, the morning buffet one of the best in Singapore has a wide choice, try to get a deal with breakfast included. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who may be going to Singapore or to those who go there and may not be aware of it.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: alex255060
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Pan Pacific Orchard on our way home from Paris. Executive Club level was wonderful. Our room was huge and totally clean and comfortable. The beverages and snacks in the Club lounge were plentiful and served by a very gracious series of staff members. Nothing was too much trouble. We will certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Suite”
Reviews.Author: Samiloupepperell
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite which came with lounge access. We booked early direct with the hotel and got a fantastic deal, great if you know your dates and are able to stick with them. The rooms are large and very well furnished, with a huge bath/shower room. The lounge served one of the best breakfast,s we've tasted, buffet style but also with a menu for hot items, the scrambled egg and smoked salmon bagel was srcumptious. The location is excellent, within a 5 minute walk of the new ION shopping mall on Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek service, great location, good value of money...”
Reviews.Author: deaw4665
Reviews.Content: The service was great, as well as the comfortable of overal stay.... despite the impression of the room, which was old and confused (design). Check-in was quick and smooth, only minutes and up to room. Check-out was a bit confusing, as staff claimed that I have taken a Fiji water, which has not been pre-set before my arrival, thanks to the attention of the staff - took this out of the bill afterwards. Location is great, just minutes away to Orchard road, ideal hotel for shoppers!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Renoir_Perth
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights in a Pacific Club Executive Room. Arrived very early in the morning. Whilst unable to check in early, was given the option to have a room for a half day rate. The room was very comfortable and well appointed. The bathroom was massive with a huge bath and a shower with amazing water pressure that could knock you over. Ceanliness and service standards are very high. Snacks and cocktails in the club lounge every evening a very pleasant way to end a day. Breakfast was either a large selection from the buffet or from a menu - could amend menu options as well. Friendly and efficient staff - very polite and courteous. The hotel is fantastically located, about 10 minute walk from Orchard MRT station and several shopping centres. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific Orchard is Tops!”
Reviews.Author: EDS_3425
Reviews.Content: There are several hotels with similar names, however, there is only one Pan Pacific Orchard hotel. This modern, clean hotel was only equaled by the friendly caring staff. The reception desk is different from the typical check in counter and you are treated individually when you arrive where all your questions are answered. The rooms are surprisingly large and very clean. Connecting to the internet or using other electrical connections was a snap with the helpful converters the staff provided as loaners. This hotel ranks as one of the finest anywhere to be found. In addition to recommending this to a friend, I hope to visit again to see the many attractions that couls not be seen in three days. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly! Eric S.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific getaway”
Reviews.Author: Isayman
Reviews.Content: Didn't expect my weekend get away with hubby was so worthwhile. The Pan Pacific Orchard does not look 5 star from the outside but not until we experienced the 5 star service from every staff we met. The room is just nice and comfortable. Every request we made was attended promptly that we cannot fault anything during our two days stay. The only thing just not to my liking is the black color marble used every where in the lobby that makes the place look gloomy. Having given a special rate, its really value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay when in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: maryannh888
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very trendy and modern, the staff are very professional, friendly and recognized me by name. They went out of their way to make my two children comfortable. The room amenities are excellent, cleanliness and service standards are high. Rooms are spacious and well appointed, couldn't ask for more ................! Check out the spacious pool with jacuzzi in this quiet neighbourhood just off Orchard Road. It's so convenient and centrally located. This hotel is a major credit to the Pan Pacific Hotel Chain.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Luck of our trip in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: HongKongCrazyannie
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I stay at this hotel according to the comments of this website. Actually, I had reviewed some of the bad comments of it but I still had hopes on this hotel. However...... I have stayed at this hotel on 18/3 to 21/3. (3 days). When I arrived at this hotel at about 4pm, there was a lady (I think she's an Indian) serve me at the front desk. When I gave her two Invoices (one is 18-20/3 twin bedroom without breakfast and 20/3-21//3 with double bed and breakfast), she told me that there's no double bed at all. She also said that the invoice indicated I only had twin bedroom. I asked back that another invoice had indicated the double bed room so far. So, I requested to stay one night then changed the room. She took me a long long time to search it and she seemed on dream..... Another staff (she may be a Singapore lady) told me that she would try to arrange a double bed room for me but I should wait about 1-2 hours. In fact, we didn't mind to wait it. After 2 hours later, the Singapore staff gave the room key to me. However, when I asked her I should have breakfast on 21/3, she told me that she had not received the invoice of 20-21/3. When she asked the Indian staff, the Indian staff told that she had returned the invoice to me and she had not got it. I felt very angry and I was sure that she had received it. She denied on it so far. The Singapore staff asked me to search myself and they still defensed on receiving the invoice. After a moment, the Singapore staff found that the documents had such invoice and she arranged it immediately. However, what disappointed me?? It's the Indian staff left then without saying sorry on her lies while the Singapore staff was the same. They ignored this incident and only gave me the room key that's all. I felt extremely angry and I told the Singapore staff about my disappointment. However, she only replied " Do you want the Indian to say sorry to you, OK, wait" See, this is this HOTEL SERVICE. I wondered such star hotel had trained such staff and such reaction to customers. Actually, the accommodation of this hotel was not bad, but... such unhelpful hotel service really scared me at all.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant & close to shopping !”
Reviews.Author: meaw_chick
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just recently stayed there for 2 nights during Singapore stop over (Feb 13 - 14, 2010). The hotel itself is charming and very nice, as well as staffs are professional. We arrived to hotrel around 2:30 am in the morning. Front desk staff was waiting for us and it was a super quick check in I ever had. Pan Pacific Orchard is 10 - 15 minute walk to ION, ISETAN and bunch of shopping malls, restaurants, MRT station. We love our Deluxe room with big closet. Bathroom is big enough. It has shower stall and bath tub as well for your selection. Swiming pool is big but it was very hot during the day so we didn't have a chance to relax by the pool. It has only one restaurant. International buffet breakfast has variety selection (fruits, pastry, juices, Dimsum, coffe, tea, etc). The price is quite expensive but worth it. Do not order anything from hotel lobby though, very expensive for a cup of tea! We stayed there on Chinese NewYear and hotel has arranged some Chinese celebration show inside the hotel during morning time. It was very noisy but my boyfriend had a lot of fun collecting chocolate coin from dragon, lol. We will definitely stay there again next time we visit Singapore. ps: Mattress is not comfy, be aware if you have neck/ back pain problem.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: frannyr01
Reviews.Content: have just had 2 night stopover on way back from Australia,and was delighted with our choice the staff are all so friendly,rooms great,meals are top class ( even better as it was through Singapore Airlines and we got 50% discount on meals the pool is massive and is mineral water so no sore eyes

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for short or long stay.”
Reviews.Author: SRS62_Traveler
Reviews.Content: During a break from traveling in Thailand, I stopped over in Singapore for 12 days to play golf and stayed at the Pan Pacific Orchard. Excellent hotel. The location is very good as it's a short walk to upper end shopping, entertainment (day and night), restaurants. I stayed in a suite which was recently renovated (Pacific Club King). My reservation included the club option which I would highly recommend. Wired internet is free in the room. The attention to detail in the room is excellent, from the lighting system to the office supplies provided. The fitness center is one of the best I've seen and the pool is filled with mineral water (no chlorine!). The staff are very kind and attentive. In researching location, luxury, amenities, cost, services, condition of hotel/room, I chose this hotel. I've stayed at a few other Singapore hotels in the past and feel this one hits the mark on what I was looking for. I would stay here again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, competent staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: AlexHM65
Reviews.Content: Good and very clean hotel with modern design and friendly, competent staff in a great location for shopping. Numerous shopping centers catering to a wide range of customers within walking distance. Plenty of eating and drinking spots in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pan Pacific Orchard!”
Reviews.Author: mikesmyth
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks in January as part of a big group trip and really liked the hotel. I thought we were booked at the OTHER Pan Pacific initially, so wasn't sure what to think when I found out that we were booked for the Orchard location. But all-in-all, I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms are really nice and the bathrooms are huge (The water pressure in the shower will knock you over!) We did not have wireless Internet, but our room rate included free Internet (via wall jack). View from the 9th floor was just o.k. (facing Orchard is not as nice as the view facing the pool). The gym is not very good and was always crowded in the mornings (2 treadmills, one bike, and some weight equipment, but that's about it). There is a nice pool and a large spa on the same floor as the gym. The breakfast at the lobby restaurant is awesome and they changed things up every morning. The lobby bar has a 2-for-1 happy hour from 5 until 8 in the evenings. I though the staff was very friendly and helpful and the guys at the front door were able to get us big vans for our group within 5 minutes. Location wise, I thought the Pan Pacific was in a good spot, but I would probably stay in a different area the next time. (It is right behind Orchard Towers, so you will see some strange stuff if and when you venture out at night). It's near a lot of restaurants and there is tons of shopping/malls (but I think that is everywhere in Singapore, right?) Cabs are very cheap, so we never really took the MRT anywhere. I'm not sure what we paid as it was part of a group package, but I think it's cheaper than many of the other options in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: PaulVisionary
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on a business trip. Excellent service staff both at this and the Pan Pacific (Marina Square)

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels”
Reviews.Author: Cloudie
Reviews.Content: This is the third hotel I have stayed in whilst visiting Singapore. The bed and room was comfortable albeit small. The check-in/out service I found unusually off-handed which is strange for Singapore. We had no problems or disagreement but found the receptionist quite sullen. Perhaps it was just a long and bad day for her. Check-in/out was at two desks where you sat whilst they booked you in. It would be slow at busy times. I have stayed at the Hilton and the Regent for the same price category - we travelled with Singapore Airlines overnight stay service. Stay elsewhere for the same price. There is definitely better and brighter places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: IBMconnects
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay and the staffs are very friendly. Rooms are clean and pool is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huskymaster
Reviews.Content: The staff is fantastic! Great hotel, will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Delight”
Reviews.Author: Mcgeniuz
Reviews.Content: A weekend stay at the Pan Pacific Orchard was something that my partner and I stumbled upon. Wouldn't have been a number one choice however we decided to try our luck. Indeed it was a delightful experience. We needed a getaway to come out of this monotonous routine in SG. The staff are absolutely friendly and more than willing to go the extra mile so as to make guests feel at home. A reservation for the Premium Deluxe was made. Upon check in, knowing it was a special day for us, they upgraded us to the next available category and even included club benefits. It was certainly unexpected, but a real pleasant surprise. The room decor screamed sophistication and clearly well maintained. Overall, a thumbs up for the service and kudoos to the efforts by staff of Pan Pacific Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Kyerul_Sykes
Reviews.Content: Spending the weekend with friends in a hotel is what I've always wanted to do..Reception staff is friendly and made us feel welcome when we are checking-in.And the operators who call themselves Service One is indeed the only pit stop for everything-in room dining, laundry service etc.Rooms are cozy and comfortable but I wish they had more varieties in the Minibar!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: AthenaQld
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for 2 weeks and had an enjoyable stay. The kids particularly enjoyed the pool and spa/sauna. I on the other hand, took advantage of the shopping malls, walking distance to the hotel. The food was great and staffs were attentive at all times. We strongly recommend travellers to stay at this hotel for its location and five-star stay. Tip: Buy an MRT card as it's fast and cheap to travel around Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...But can be better”
Reviews.Author: fusooy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 12.12.09 for 1 night with wife and daughter in the premium deluxe room. checking in was not a breeze as there were only 2 check in counters and both were occupied. i had requested for a smoking room. my room was on the 6th floor. As soon as we got out of the 6th floor lift lobby, the cigarette stench was strong. Applying fragrance could have been better on the smoking floors. the cigarette smell in our room was even more unbearable. Room was spacious though. our room overlooked the swimming pool which is on the 4th floor. swimming pool was nothing fantastic. quite simple and had jacuzzi and baby pool. couldnt comment on the hotel's breakfast though as I had missed it. location wise, a good one for shoppers as it is right in the middle of orchard road. another plus point, there is a 24-hr Jason's Supermarket just next to the hotel. overall. nice hotel but it could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience with Pan Pacific Orchard”
Reviews.Author: DeDeChooi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific Orchard at the tail end of our Malaysia/Singapore holiday for 3 nights. All I can say about the hotel is that they are dodgy and unprofessional. We paid to stay in the Pacific Club rooms to get all the extra privileges, as we always do with all hotels we stay in. This is particularly important to us as we do laundry regularly, and like to have this thrown into the package. Upon check-in to the hotel, we received a welcome letter which outlined all the privileges of the Pacific Club room, and what we were entitled to. The letter listed that we were (quote) "entitled to 2 pieces of laundry, non-accumulative". So straight away we sent for 2 pieces of dirty laundry to be laundered. The laundry came back with a cost attached, so we rang reception and questioned them about this. Front desk said that club privileges was only for clothes 'pressing' - but this was NOT was we read in the letter. We were so furious we decided to show them the letter we received upon arrival - and funnily enough (and very handy for them), housekeeping had decided to throw this letter away from our desk - which was laid out in the middle of the desk. Bewildered we asked reception to send the letter up again - and guess what, the letter had been amended, even the way they addressed us in the letter was different. We mentioned that this is a different letter - and they said this is the standard letter they give out to all people. Why we remembered this was different is because the original letter ''welcomed'' us ''back'' to the hotel - we thought this was strange as we've never stayed at this hotel before. This left a VERY sour taste, and we will never stay or recommend anyone to stay at this hotel. One thing I should mention is that to their credit, they noted that I was also celebrating my birthday, and sent a beautiful chocolate mud cake which was great. May I also say however that their sister hotel Pan Pacific at Marina Bay is in an entirely different league - they are a MUST stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good position for the shops”
Reviews.Author: Argonsell
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of days whilst passing through Singapore. Hotel was on a promotion through Singapore Air so we had a great deal. Hotel is 50 yrds from the main shopping centres on Orchard Road so has a great position. Rooms were a nice size and the bathrooms well laid out. Front of house staff were always very helpful and friendly and we found that we used the Lobby Bar a bit as the food was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: SFam007
Reviews.Content: I stayed in early June as part of a business stop over. The Club rooms are a must - recently renovated - they are well worth while. The Hotel has a great housekeeping department who keep it all rolling along. It was wonderful to step out of the lifts & into the corridor & have a pleasant smell -lemon grass I think. The Club Lounge team are amazing. They really go out of their way to help you. Book tours, change flights & more importantly remember you. I was impressed that they remembered my name and preferences over the course of the week – even when it was different people who I was dealing with. I will be back in October on holiday with my wife & look forward to really relaxing in the Hotel & getting some shopping done.

Reviews.Title: “A truly Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: KMS33
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference held at Pan Pacific Orchard last week. Two words to discribe the hotel " Great Hotel". You can never go wrong chosing this hotel . The Banquet staffs were great in ensuring all our last minute changes are taken care. They do it with a smile and words like " Yes, allow me to do the changes for you " and "Yes, no issue. Let me fix it for you " can be very soothing when you have other things to worries about. Thank you, Joe, Busbindar and the rest of the staffs. .

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for its location”
Reviews.Author: DJWanderer
Reviews.Content: Decided to spend the weekend at a local hotel to celebrate my birthday with some friends, and was looking around for a good place to stay that's central and reasonably priced. Given the economic conditions, there were actually quite a lot of good choices, but a friend of mine said this would be a good place to consider. All I can say is that it's a great choice! The location is perfect for a day of shopping in Orchard, and if you like to party (like me!), there are a host of bars and good places to eat nearby the hotel. Although some people might find the nightlife distracting, it's actually a character enhancing trait to me. The rooms were really nice and clean, and the food at the hotel restaurant was scrumptious, especially since they were having a food promotion. Overall, service levels were great, and my friends who stayed with me fully intend to celebrate their brithdays there as well! PS - oh, you must check out their "mineral water pool". Quite an interesting concept!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location – Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_trips094
Reviews.Content: I stayed in early June & loved it. Great location just of Orchard road – so if you want to avoid the hustle & bustle of a busy shopping district – but still be right in the heart of it all this is the place. The Hotel itself is a little old & in need of a renovation but you will feel right at home. Check in, relax & go shopping! The highlight is the staff. They are friendly & want to help which can be rare.

Reviews.Title: “The Best experience I've ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: AlexisCD
Reviews.Content: Last weekend, we decided to celebrate my best friend's 28th birthday in a hotel room. We eventually decided on Pan Pacific Orchard because of its location near Orchard Road. We were so pleasantly surprised by how forthcoming the front desk staff was with our requests. The moment we told the staff that it's a room for a birthday celebration, the front office staff offered us a birthday cake with compliments from the hotel, and true enough, the birthday cake was sent to the room on the same day!! The only not so good point was that upon check in, we were advised that we have to keep our volume low as it's a business hotel, and that they have to ensure other hotel guests are not affected by our celebration. Other than that, the staffs from the hotel were all genuinely interested in ensuring that our stay was comfortable. They are so proactive and always ready to provide help to us whenever we needed any. It is truly a stay that I would rate it as one of the better experiences I ever encountered in Singapore and I definitely give it thumbs up and recommend anyone to stay with Pan Pacific Orchard

Reviews.Title: “Not up to 5* rating overall quality poor.Location shocking !!!”
Reviews.Author: unhappypilgrim
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights to celebrate 25th wedding anniversary with my wife after several weeks in Europe on route back to Australia. Made mention of anniversary at check in advised bottle of wine would be sent to room okay with this, was also advised we would be upgraded to club room with NO priveleges, this room was exactly same as we had paid for (Premier deluxe) only difference was bathroom toiletries big deal !!.We found bedding was feather filled and as my wife is a acute astmatic contacted staff to see if we could have this changed ,no problems with this at all, also advised staff at this time that we had cockroaches in the room to be told they dont have them at Pan Pacific Orchard as if they did not believe us.The staff called to the room to change the bedding and again commented that they do not have cockroaches at this hotel I took them into the bathroom where 2 cockraches where having a great time in the shower they immediately began to spray Mortein ( why have this if they dont have cockroach problem?) The room stank from the insect spray and I asked if we could be moved as my wife would severly react to the spray due to her asthma. We waited approx half an hour but we did get moved one floor up to exactly the same room configuration we note that we did not incur any insects in this room during our stay.I tried to make a cup of tea we found only 1 tea bag that we could drink and 2 mimiscual pots of milk I called housekeeping to ask for extra tea bags and milk, an attendee arrived 20 minutes later with only 2 tea bags and no milk I gave up so we went out and purchased our own at the local store. To my wifes horror in order to get to the store we had to pass numerous prostitutes trading their wares in the street and found out from store owner that the area is well noted for this .Disgusted that this 5* hotel was in such a location thank god we had no children with us.Back in the room the wine had arrived it was red ( we do not drink red wine at all) no corkscrew was provided to open this anyway. On Tuesday I went down to complain to the receptionists abouth the problems we had experienced they did not seem concerned but said they would pass on my comments. I saw a chap from the restaurant in the lobby and had a chat with him, it turned out he was the Manager of the restaurant and he was not impressed what we had incurred and offered my wife and I a meal on him at the restaurant to try to make amends but this was not his fault. We could not however take him up on this offer as my wife was ill for 2 days and was unable to leave the hotel and could not eat very much we had to order in toast to the room as this was all she could palate.During my wifes time in the room the phone rang at the most inconvenient times both day and night when I contacted reception on more than one occasion re this was advised no-one had called the room !!! On the morning of our check out my wife went to finalise the bill whilst I waited for a cab outside to go direct to the airport, she noticed a suited male hovering behind her while she was settling up once she had completd this he approached her and advised he was Justin the hotel Manager and wanted to know if everyting was well with our stay, my wife just wanted to get out of there as she was not fully aware of my complaints to the staff. Why did this Manager not approach myself and why did he wait until after the bill was settled to make any enquiries I complained on the Tuesday and did not check out until the Friday !!!! We paid $300 Singapore per night for this hotel and was certainly shortchanged, overall standard not up to scratch with rooms and staff . Iwould not recommend this hotel to any couple or family a Businessman may find it acceptable as they would not be paying for it themselves.Would love to hear a responce from the hotel manager Justin direct as they have our email details from the booking confirmation to date nothinghas been received still waiting

Reviews.Title: “Very very European!”
Reviews.Author: Konline
Reviews.Content: My daughter and me stayed at Pan Pacific Orchard, called the Negara on Claymore on our 1st business trip to Singapore. This Hotel is quite classy, though we found the Lobby quite dark. It seems Europeans prefer it this way. The location was quite central, whithin walking distance of Orchard Road. The breakfast was really good, and since we were there for 4 days, we could sample all the different cuisines offered a la carte at the Complimentary breakfast. rooms were good, though dark, again. Staff was efficient & friendly. All in all, we had quite a nice time here.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location & Location”
Reviews.Author: clchin96
Reviews.Content: Situated behind Orchard Road yet within walking distance to all shopping mecca and eating places along Orchard Road. The nearest MRT station is at Orchard MRT, just 10 minutes walk from the hotel. Have a huge indoor and save place to park your car. The room is spacious and clean where the furnitures are new. In evening, housekeeping staff came to rrom to inquire whether need any services that was after housekeeping was done in the afternoon. Personal touch during check in and check out. It is advisable to have breakfast to be included as it is rather difficult to get breakfast around Orchard Road say 7 in the morning. Ah, yes, the water in the swimming pool is mineral water!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Braddockrd
Reviews.Content: I got an awesome rate of 165 Singapore Dollars at the hotel counter at the airport. The going rate is always 200 plus, but at the hotel desk at the airport you always get the best deals. The staff was very nice and helpful. No internet or breakfast included, but you can have a great breakfast in SG for less than S$5 and internet is now free everywhere in Singapore. The place is right behind Orchard Towers at the west end of Orchard Rd.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: imal
Reviews.Content: Just like to share my experience staying at Pan Pacific Orchard on 14 April. I was quite impressed by the sit-down check in counter, especially after after a long haul flight but I wonder if the hotel can cope if a big group checks in at any one time. The recept girls were polite & friendly with smiles. I requested for a quiet and non-smoking room and this was arranged without any hassle. I recommend this hotel for anyone who is planning to do a fair share of shopping in Singapore. There is a high fashion shopping mall behind the hotel called Palais with brand names like DKNY. Just the right way to shop - drop your shopping bags in your room & off you go for another round of shopping down Orchard Road! Speaking of brand names, the rooms are stocked with Loccitaine toiletries so that’s a big PLUS. I would definitely return to this Hotel, on my return trip to Singapore. Not only for its amenities but the good location.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Sunny/Virginia
Reviews.Content: Good location for Orchard Road, Botanical Gardens, Black and White Houses , nice pool

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Pan Pacific Orchard Infrastructure Ruins Earnest Efforts Of Kind Staff”
Reviews.Author: philiparthurmoore
Reviews.Content: From February 19th to February 26th of this year I spent time at the Pan Pacific Orchard hotel on 10 Claymore Rd. with my grandmother. We booked a Pacific Club Executive room but were kindly upgraded to a Pacific Club Suite for the entire duration of our stay, free of charge. Free breakfast was included in the hotel’s Club Lounge as well as free internet access in our suite. Also, free daily use of the business center computers for one hour was offered to us during our stay. Before I begin my review of the hotel, a couple of notes about the circumstances of my travel to Singapore: 1) I went to Singapore for vacation, but also needed adequate arrangements for work; 2) I am a young, 26-year old traveler who stayed at the hotel with his 75-year old grandmother; 3) we paid a pretty penny for a week at the Pan Pacific Orchard, and as such, expected the quality of our stay at the hotel to conform to the amount of money that we spent during one week at the Pan Pacific Orchard. Overall Summary: Over the next few paragraphs I will be detailing why I think you should stay at a different hotel if the circumstances of your travel to Singapore are similar to those of mine, but also be giving information about the bright spots of my stay at the Pan Pacific Orchard. The bottom line is that you should not be fooled by the name “Pan Pacific” on this hotel, as the Pan Pacific Singapore, located on 7 Raffles Rd., is far superior in reputation and execution to the Pan Pacific Orchard location. And I won’t even go into detail about the horrendous case of bed bugs that I contracted during my stay at the hotel, which left me covered in hundreds of tiny red bumps, itching, and slathered in Hydrocortisone cream during my entire stay in Singapore. Staff: Let it be known that the staff at the Pan Pacific Orchard hotel is absolutely top notch. They are kind, personable, and professional on an individual level. The problem, however, is that the Pan Pacific Orchard is dreadfully understaffed, and simple requests for ice, towels, coffee, tea, electrical converters, or the like, were often addressed thirty minutes after calling down to the receptionist. Most of my calls down to the receptionist needed follow up calls, which during a stay in a “five star” suite is unacceptable. I understand that this may have been due to the hotel being understaffed, but truthfully it is the onus of the hotel owners to hire enough staff members to keep high paying customers happy. That said, I can’t put any fault on any of the staff members individually. They were all very nice and did their best, given the circumstances. From the receptionists to the cleaners I felt welcomed. Food in the Club Lounge: Most of my week was spent eating out, but I did enjoy free breakfast at the Club Lounge every morning, as well as free afternoon cocktails during the afternoon and free drinks and snacks throughout the entire day. The made to order breakfast at the Club Lounge was perfectly fine. My grandmother is quite particular when it comes to her Eggs Florentine, so she griped a little bit, but I did not have any problems with the food. The eggs were hot and delicious, the bacon was crispy, and the cold fruits and salads all tasted fresh and clean. During my week at the hotel I had bread, eggs, jams and jellies, muesli, fruits, salads, teas, and juices, and they all tasted spectacular. The staff in the Club Lounge was wonderful and always had a collective smile on its face. I will say though that you should not expect high quality cocktails during the evening time in the Club Lounge. Very basic drinks may be okay, but anything else and expect a very subpar drink. 10 at Claymore Restaurant: During our last night at the hotel, my grandmother and I ate at the 10 at Claymore Restaurant, located to your left after walking into the hotel. The drinks were made proper, and the food was acceptable, but the temperature control on the meat, poultry, and fish seemed out of control. What I mean is that meat dishes would be inconsistent with regard to heat, which makes a meal taste terrible. One side of the buffet line would have super hot food, while the other side would have food that was supposed to be hot, but was in fact lukewarm or even cold. This isn’t a good touch for the restaurant and left quite a foul taste in the mouths of my grandmother and I. The only redeeming quality of the restaurant was the staff, which was in fact the only redeeming quality of the entire hotel. The Location of the Pan Pacific Orchard: If you have small children, are a young couple looking for a nice area for your Singapore night activities, or travel with your grandmother (!), do NOT book your stay at the Pan Pacific Orchard. True story: the Pan Pacific Orchard is located directly next to Orchard Towers, infamously known as the “Four Floors of Whor...” all throughout Singapore. Absolutely every single night that you walk out of the Pan Pacific Orchard hotel at 7PM, expect to see massive numbers of pimps, prostitutes of all nationalities, and transsexuals. Funny enough, I don’t necessarily have a problem with prostitution in and of itself, but had I known that my grandmother (!) and I would be staying ten paces away from lines of bars and prostitutes, I would have never agreed to stay at the Pan Pacific Orchard. This is not a family friendly location at all. Do not bring your young children for a walk at night around Orchard towers unless you are happy talking to them about sex at an early age. On two occasions gentleman brought their prostitutes into the Club Lounge at the hotel, which was completely not acceptable to me; not because I think they shouldn’t have rights to use the lounge, but because It’s quite unsettling to stay in a supposedly upscale location with your grandmother and see women in skin tight skirts eating breakfast next to you. Not cool. Our Room: All in all, the room wasn’t anything to write home about, other than to tell my family and friends that I came down with a massive case of bed bugs at an upscale hotel. Our suite had two TVs, two rooms that could be separated by a sliding door, one bathroom, one shower, a min-bar, and a couch. The beds were very old and uncomfortable, as well as the couch. The shower, on the other hand, was a wonderful experience. While you should expect to have to ask over and over for more soap and shampoo, the actual shower experience was a pretty good one. Water pressure was high and heat stayed consistent throughout the shower. Watch out though, as your shower will invariably create a large puddle of water in front of the shower door. Place a large towel in front of your door so you don’t slip. The toilet was alright; nothing amazing, really. As I said, for the price that my grandmother and I paid, the room was really nothing to write home about, which is primarily the reason I will not be staying at the hotel again. It’s not as though I dislike the people who work there, but the operation as a whole is just missing a few screws, and the hotel is old and run down. Put it this way: I’d be willing to stay at the Pan Pacific Orchard for much cheaper rates. So there you have it. I have attached photos to this review. Remember: the staff is great; but the poor execution of the hotel running smoothly, the seedy location, and the bed bugs just broke the deal for me. I won’t be staying at the Pan Pacific Orchard ever again, and after my stay at the Raffles location, know that the Orchard location doesn’t deserve to have the “Pan Pacific” branding on its outside walls.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Knight59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific Orchard for our 22nd wedding anniversary for a week in October 2008.We visit Singapore twice a year and mostly stay at either the Hilton or Pan Pacific (Marina).They are very good hotels.This time we thought we would try the Pan Pacific Orchard.We were disappoined.From check-in (no smile or greeting) to the dated furniture and carpets in our executive suite.The only positive was the attentive staff in the club lounge.We were also somewhat surprised that the ladies of the night were plying their trade just 50 metres from the hotel.Unless Pan Pac Orchard lifts their game substantially we won't have an ocassion to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Service Attitude is an issue”
Reviews.Author: JunianSH
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is fine, next to Orchard Rd (shoping paradise). However, during the evening the adjacent street seems to be occupied by easy going ladies. The rooms are a bit old fashioned and have a complicated remote system that should control all the lights and aircon. The rooms definitely don't meet my expectation for a 5 star hotel. But what was really unsatisfactory is the service quality of the staff. A greeting or a smile is very rare, and very often there is no staff around to help.

Reviews.Title: “Go for Pan Pacific Club Floor!”
Reviews.Author: dominik_r
Reviews.Content: I did stay many times in Singapore and during my recent stay I choose the Pan Pacific Orchard. I stayed in one of their suites which are very spacious. The interior style of my suite looks a little worn out, but indeed comfy and classy! Toilet flushes like a rocket which is sometimes a little noisy. Overall a good product- not top notch, but for the price paid indeed perfect. During my stay I was invited to use the Pan Pacific Club for all day refreshments, breakfast and evening cocktails. The service received from all the Club Floor staff was very nice. Quality of products is top notch and the atmosphere is relaxed. For breakfast there is a buffet as well as a menu for cooked to order hot dishes. For my next stay in Singapore I will return to the Pan Pacific Orchard!

Reviews.Title: “A true Business Persons Hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_AP_Rover
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Hotel since it first opened, many years ago! The staff are consistantly attentive, there is no "check in" counter; just a desk and chair. I have never had to queue for check in or out and there are usually no children to be seen anywhere! The Pacific Club is absolutely worth the extra money with a quiet, spacious lounge on the ground floor rear. I would recommend this to any business person who dosn't want to be stuck behind a bus load of tourists and annoyed by screaming children (the main reason I switched to this hotel). Great location with Westren style pubs and food next door plus a seriously up-market supermarket! The only thing wrong with the place is the room key operated lifts- they don't work very efficiently (and they never have!)

Reviews.Title: “Huge improvement”
Reviews.Author: dutchkiwi
Reviews.Content: The Negara on Claymore has been reborn as the Pan Pacific Orchard. The vast improvement is evident throughout the hotel. The lobby, reception area and front of the hotel have received a good facelift. The room I stayed in was very comfortable, with a good solid bed and flat screen TV. The bathroom had a shower only (rain shower head). Breakfast buffet has a good variety of offerings. The location of the hotel is great, just off Orchard Road. A great Irish pub around the corner. The hotel has a good pool area and healthclub. I did not have time to use the spa, maybe next time around. It is also obvious that the staff seem to be enjoying the transition as several commented during my stay that this is now a Pan Pacific as if to say, we are a real hotel now. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at the Negara”
Reviews.Author: Starkmarty
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner just returned from a 4 day stay at the Pan Pacific Orchard, formerly Negara on Claymore in Singapore. This a very good hotel with great service at a reasonable price. Rooms were good, the King size bed a delight to sleep in, and the breakfast was outstanding. Staff were attentive and nothing was a problem. After check out we spent a day at Sentosa island and returned for a shower and to collect our luggage before an easy 20 min taxi ride(S$16) to the magnificent Changi airport. My only gripe was paying S$7.00 for a warmish small can of Coke from the Mini-bar... beware

HotelInfo.Name: Pan Pacific Orchard
HotelInfo.Address: 10 Claymore Road, Singapore 229540, Singapore (Formerly Negara on Claymore)
